alert.note: Alert for Orange; Putnam; Rockland; Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 6:34PM EDT until July 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR PORTIONS OF THE LOWER HUDSON VALLEY... ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE, WESTERN PUTNAM, ROCKLAND AND NORTHERN WESTCHESTER COUNTIES... At 634 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area have caused significant flash flooding. Between 5 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Portions of the Lower Hudson Valley. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Peekskill, West Point, Cold Spring, Stony Point, Putnam Valley, Woodbury, West Haverstraw, Thiells, Highland Falls, Cornwall On Hudson, Buchanan and Fort Montgomery. There is currently a break in the heavy rainfall. Residual runoff however will continue to produce dangerous flooding. Additional showers and thunderstorms are expected to overspread the area from the south this evening. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
